overview_summary: None of the four profiled neighbors have a clearly documented stance in public records regarding the proposed development. Two neighbors – a local financial advisor and a high school coach – hold moderate influence in the community through their professional roles, while the others maintain lower profiles and no formal leadership positions.

neighbors.name: Clayton D. Cordell Jr. & Alayssa L. Cordell
neighbors.claims: Clayton D. "Doug" Cordell Jr., a retired U.S. Army veteran, passed away on Feb. 12, 2024 at age 67 [Chronicle-Tribune](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/chronicle-tribune/name/clayton-cordell-obituary?id=54378065). The Cordells’ land lies between Cloverdale and Jefferson Townships in Putnam County, an area where a 2,000-acre solar farm was proposed and ultimately rejected by county officials in 2025 [Terre Haute Vice News](https://terrehautevice.com/2025/10/07/putnam-says-no-residents-commissioners-reject-2000-acre-solar-proposal/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected farming peer or local veteran approach Alayssa Cordell, emphasizing how project plans protect farmland use and maintain the area’s quiet rural character.

neighbors.name: Johnnie L. Chestnut
neighbors.claims: Johnnie L. Chestnut is a certified financial planner (CFP and AIF) based in Cloverdale, Indiana, working with Osaic Advisory Services [AdvisorCheck](https://www.advisorcheck.com/advisor/3262183-johnnie-lee-chestnut-osaic-advisory-services-llc-cloverdale-indiana). He began his finance career in 1999, has been employed at seven firms, and holds multiple securities licenses (Series 7, 63, 66, etc.) [AdvisorCheck](https://www.advisorcheck.com/advisor/3262183-johnnie-lee-chestnut-osaic-advisory-services-llc-cloverdale-indiana). No public record of Chestnut taking a position on local development issues was found in available county minutes or news reports.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a fellow business professional or community leader to discuss how the project will safeguard nearby property values and preserve the area’s tranquility, addressing any financial or quality-of-life concerns.

neighbors.name: Tyler K. Lotz & Jessica P. Winders
neighbors.claims: Tyler K. Lotz serves as the head coach of Cloverdale High School’s football team, a position he has held for several seasons [GIANT fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/cloverdale-ready-for-new-season-future-changes/). The property is co-owned by Jessica P. Winders, but no additional public background information on Winders was readily available. There is no record of Lotz or Winders speaking publicly about local development or energy projects in Putnam County.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted educator or coach from the area talk with the couple, highlighting how project plans include visual screening and noise minimization to preserve the peaceful, scenic environment they value.

neighbors.name: Tyson D. Hillenburg & Jillianne N. Hillenburg
neighbors.claims: Tyson D. Hillenburg appears to be a newer member of the community, with public records indicating a previous residence in Bedford, Indiana as of the early 2010s [LocateFamily](https://www.locatefamily.com/H/HIL/HILLENBURG-22.html). Jillianne N. Hillenburg’s background is not documented in local public sources, and neither Tyson nor Jillianne have been mentioned in news reports or county records concerning development or energy projects. Their property is agricultural, but they have not publicly voiced any opinions on land use changes.

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via a local agriculture extension or conservation official who can address how the project will protect farmland integrity and manage water drainage, reassuring the Hillenburgs that their land and crops won’t be adversely affected.
